 I have no good advice to give anyone about coming out to parents, especially those of the hardcore Christian persuasion. I never came to mine -- I lived on a different continent by the time that became an issue, and it was just easier not to deal with it at all. I'm not saying that was the right thing to do, but it was expedient.

Some Christian parents will disown and kick out their gay child, while others wil make their home life even more unbearable. Few will be understanding, let alone welcoming or happily accepting.  On the other hand, secrets are corrosive to any close relationship. If you can't tell your parents, staying close to them in the long run is, to say the least, difficult.
